conversation.content: Pass the stuffing before Uncle Jerry tells another fishing story.
Too late—he's already winding up with the hand gestures! Quick, stuff your mouth with potatoes so you can't respond, it's the only defense that works reliably.
Is that cranberry sauce or congealed regret?
Both! Mom made it from scratch this year, which apparently means she added existential dread as the secret ingredient—tastes like disappointment with a hint of cinnamon.
Why is, um, Aunt Linda's casserole, you know, glowing like that—is it, err, supposed to be radioactive?
She discovered Pinterest last month and now everything she makes has at least seventeen ingredients that shouldn't exist in the same universe, let alone the same dish.
Dad's doing his turkey speech again.
Oh no, he's getting [gasp] emotional about the pilgrim—I mean, we've heard this, actually, thirty-seven times but somehow it gets longer every year!
Twenty bucks says Grandma brings up your dating life before dessert.
Absolutely not taking that bet—she's already been eyeing me like a hawk since I walked in solo, preparing her list of eligible grandchildren from her bridge club.
She's making her [gasp softly] move toward you right now.
Abort mission! I'm going to, well, hide in the bathroom—no wait, honestly, that's where cousin Tommy's been crying about his, um, cryptocurrency losses all evening.
So, uh, speaking of disasters, [friendly] remember when you, basically, set the turkey on fire, like, three years ago?
That was not my fault! The recipe said, you know, "flambe" and I thought, err, why not make it spectacular—nobody told me, honestly, you're not supposed to use half a bottle of brandy!
The ceiling still has that scorch mark.
Mom refuses to paint [speeding up] over it because she says it's a reminder of why I'm permanently banned from all cooking duties forever and ever amen.
Is that why you brought store-bought rolls?
Listen, I, actually, tried to make them from scratch but they turned out, well, harder than hockey pucks—even the dog wouldn't, you know, touch them.
At least you didn't [joking] poison anyone this year.
Yet! The night is still [very sad] young and Uncle Jerry just opened his homemade wine that tastes suspiciously like paint thinner mixed with regret and false hopes.
